Posts.Content: I have been on tamoxifen for 2 years--hot flashes & leg cramps have been the worst side effects. The benefits outweigh the side effects for me. My onc wanted me to take the baby aspirin to ward off blood clots, but it upset my stomach too much.
Posts.Title: 1st day of Tamoxifen....what to expect...5 yrs!!!

Posts.Content: Susan, you will be in my thoughts & prayers tomorrow. Let us know how you get along when you are able. Hugs....
Posts.Title: Tomorrow's the "Day" (10--21-09)

Posts.Content: I am sorry to hear of your new bc dx. I had DCIS in 2009 (age 62), with lumpectomy, rads, & now tamoxifen. I have found a few annoying side effects with tamoxifen, but, to me, it is worth it. Same for rads--if it increases my chances of survival--I will go for it! I,too, am a very active person, but have tried to let the bc give me a new appreciation of life. I work full time & do a lot of volunteer work, also. I do not belong to any group, but this website has been a godsend. Best wishes in your treatment. Hugs & prayers sent your way....
Posts.Title: Recurrence Very Rare for Initial Cancer 0 Stage DCIS

Posts.Content: Welcome, Geannine, and good luck with your tests. You have certainly come to the right place. I didn't tell anyone until my docs had set me on a course of treatment. I had to tell my work because I needed time off for treatment. But I put off telling acquaintances, neighbors, etc. as long as possible. I hated telling my elderly parents & my son (deployed in Iraq), but I knew they would find out sooner or later. (((Hugs)))and prayers sent your way....
Posts.Title: I am very scared!

Posts.Content: Welcome, Geannine, and good luck with your tests. You have certainly come to the right place. I didn't tell anyone until my docs had sent me on a course of treatment. I had to tell my work because I needed time off for treatment. But I put off telling acquaintances, neighbors, etc. as long as possible. I hated telling my elderly parents & my son (deployed in Iraq), but I knew they would find out sooner or later. I agree with the above poster who said that "friends" just came out of the woodwork --usually with a story of some relative of theirs who had bc. Really, they could have cared less about me, and they were just being "nosy." I would just shift to another topic. (((Hugs)))and prayers sent your way....
Posts.Title: I am very scared!

Posts.Content: I had 33 rads--the standard in my area. I went every weekday at the same time (after work). The drive (45 mn.) was the worst, but I am glad to have it over with. I didn't miss any days, but they were flexible on the time of day that I could come. Be sure to get plenty of rest now, during rads, & after.
Posts.Title: Triple negative and radiation treatment

Posts.Content: I will be thinking of you tomorrow. When you're able,let us know how everything goes. (((Hugs))) and prayers sent your way!
Posts.Title: Requesting the Pink Bus for tomorrow

Posts.Content: So sorry that your daughter is having to go through this. I hope everything goes well for her. Hugs & prayers sent your way....
Posts.Title: prayers for my daughter

Posts.Content: Hugs & prayers sent for your friend...
Posts.Title: Benefit for a friend, need prayers

Posts.Content: Pat, so sorry to hear that "something" has come up. Please keep us posted on what is happening. Sending hugs & payers your way....
Posts.Title: Definitely NOT Dancing With Ned

Posts.Content: Got my flu shot today at PCP office. Today was my last day for rads! Actually, I went once in the a.m. and again in the p.m.--with flu shot in between.
Posts.Title: Got my Flu Shot today, did you get yours?

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy & started rads 3-4 weeks afterwards. My onc really pushed the schedule, because I was a teacher and he wanted to get it started before school started in the fall. I was glad to get it over with. Best wishes on the rest of your treatment.
Posts.Title: How long after surgery before starting radiation?

Posts.Content: Thanks for posing, Melissa. Your mom was so very special and loved very much on this board. We were all sorry to hear of her passing. Our thoughts & prayers are with you--check back with us often!
Posts.Title: Laurissa

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear of your setback. Hope everything goes OK with biopsy on Th. (((hugs))) and prayers for you. Keep us posted.
Posts.Title: One step forward and two steps back?

Posts.Content: The rads nurse gave me cream to use after every treatment.  I was a middle school teacher at the time (now retired) and am rather "busty", so I had to wear a bra every day.  I went to the local discount store & got a couple of "Just My Size "bras in cotton in a size or 2 bigger. I wore them the whole time.  I got blisters & burned near the end & the nurse recommended Domboro Soaks--I bought plain white flannel at the fabric store, cut it into big squares & laid them on the affected area.  I also lined my bra with them at the very end.  I was absolutely determined to get through it! Also, I felt a bit nauseated toward the end--mints & a Vick's nasal inhaler helped me.  All I did was work & go to rads during that time, but I never felt fatigue--kept waiting for it, but it never happened!   Good luck with the rads--just take it a day at a time & it will be over before you know it!
Posts.Title: What helped you during radiation?

Posts.Content: They told me that I could use cornstarch, too, but I couldn't figure out how to use it along with the lotion. I used lotion in the morn., after rads in the rad room, & at night. I thought the cornstarch would make a big mess when used with the lotion& then I would have to scrub (ouch!) to get it off. The cream the nurse gave me was mostly aloe. Good luck with your rads!
Posts.Title: Overachieving Rad Girl -- would appreciate advice from Rad Graduates!

Posts.Content: I felt very sick near the end of rads. I could not stand the smell of food--kind of like morning sickness. I worked full time at a demanding job, so I think I was just exhausted. It got better after rads ended. My doc knew I felt really sick, but I didn't get any meds. Also, I had gangrene in a tooth at the time, so that may have caused it.
Posts.Title: Nauseated with Rads ???

Posts.Content: I felt very sick near the end of rads. I could not stand the smell of food--kind of like morning sickness. I worked full time at a demanding job, so I think I was just exhausted. It got better after rads ended. My doc knew I felt really sick, but I didn't get any meds. Also, I had gangrene in a tooth at the time, so that may have caused it.

Posts.Content: The rads nurse gave me cream to use after every treatment.  I was a middle school teacher at the time (now retired) and am rather "busty", so I had to wear a bra every day.  I went to the local discount store & got a couple of "Just My Size "bras in cotton in a size or 2 bigger. Posts.Title: What helped you during radiation?

Posts.Content: Congrats on your good news! I am sure that it is a big relief to you-- TO BE "officially" clear!
Posts.Title: I met with NED yesterday too!

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear of your MIL's passing, especially after losing your own mom so recently. (((Hugs))) and prayers for you & your family.
Posts.Title: MIL Passed Away

Posts.Content: Pat, congratulations on finishing up rads! My rad techs let me come twice on the last day so I could finish on Friday! I went in the morning & in the afternoon that day. What a great feeling to be done! I hope everything else goes great for you also! Hugs & prayers sent your way....
Posts.Title: Going for next to last treatment for radiation in a snow storm.Am I nuts(probley).

Posts.Content: Peggy, so sorry to hear your news. I have not had the same dx as you, so I can be of no help there. My thoughts & prayers are with you.. keep us informed... hugs...
Posts.Title: Stage 4 and recent MRI scan not good.....

Posts.Content: Thanks for the good wishes! Today I have radiation- day #5. I am a teacher, so school starts soon. My school has been really great & a colleague is teaching my last class of the day so that I can get to radiation treatments. One thing I have learned--don't be afraid to ask for help! Good luck to everyone who has chemo, rads, appmts., etc. this week!
Posts.Title: Good Luck

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing your great news with us--hope the rest of your rads go well!
Posts.Title: Great 6 monthl check-up

Posts.Content: My whole life I have loved blue! However, I wear lots of red!
Posts.Title: I thought it would be great to see what your favorite color is, so, what is your favorite color?

Posts.Content: I had a needle loc before my lumpectomy & it did not hurt at all! I was sort of scared because I had not had a good experience with a previous biopsy, but this was painless! The nurses & doctors were just great! I hope your goes as well as mine. It makes sense that they would try to locate the offending cells as best they can to remove them. It did take a while, though, but I could rest/change position any time I needed to. Good luck..
Posts.Title: question about a lumpectomy

Posts.Content: When is your next doctor's appmt? Are you in radiation? I would prob. call the doctor if you don't have an appmt. coming up. Or, if you are in rads, ask your nurse/doc about it. Good luck!
Posts.Title: breast hard after lumpetomy

Posts.Content: I also know how you feel--seems so unfair. Just remember that we are always here for you!
Posts.Title: I feel very old today...but I'm not really old

Posts.Content: I too have had lots of sleep issues since bc dx. Stress-induced insomnia, I think. It is getting better as time goes on. Naps after work help. Hope it continues to improve.
Posts.Title: Sleep?

Posts.Content: Thanks, Remster, for your words--gives us immeasurable hope!
Posts.Title: Inflammatory Breast cancer

Posts.Content: I have had skin allergies for decades, so I was not surprised when itching started. I am already on meds to control it, but I have found that OTC hydrocortisonecream has helped. Also, I got some roll-on stuff to carry in my purse. Hope you can get some relief!
Posts.Title: What can I do to stop the itch?

Posts.Content: Tylenol P.M. has helped me; hope you can get some rest.
Posts.Title: Up all Night

Posts.Content: Chen, I hope that you can get some answers at your appmt. on Mon. I'll be thinking of you & wishing you the best. Let us know what happens! I hope you have a good weekend.
Posts.Title: ((( CLAUDIA )))) AKA ((( CHENHEART))) Just following up..
